page.title: 12SCHOOL
page.content: The school stands in Bonfire Lane,close to Charlton Mackrell Church.It was founded in 1852 with money left for the purpose by Arch- deacon Brymer on land given for the building by Squire Dickinson of Kingweston.It is a Victorian building with the interior walls of the oldest rooms covered to ceiling level with encaustic tiles.The interior has been extensively remodelled in the last 20 years and 2 temporary classrooms have been erected.Originally an all- age school it now has pupils from four to eleven years of age,divided into three classes.There is a staff of headmistress,two fulltime and one part-time teacher.Midday meals are brought to the school from a central kitchen in Stoke-sub-Hamdon.When the children leave the school they go on to HUISH Episcopi Comprehensive School
